newsitem.title: USA: ADT sues Chase over hostile bid.
newsitem.headline: ADT sues Chase over hostile bid.

text.p: ADT Operations Inc filed suit Monday against former banker and financial adviser Chase Manhattan Corp, charging it with breach of fiduciary duty for assisting Western Resources Inc in a hostile bid for the security company.
The lawsuit, filed in New York State Supreme Court, seeks $50 million in punitive damages from Chase and requests that Chase be prohibited from involvement in Western's bid.
ADT contends that Chase, which was its banker and financial adviser since at least 1993, had agreed not to participate in a hostile takeover of the company.
ADT Operations is a subsidiary of ADT Ltd.
Western Resources launched a $3.5 billion hostile bid for ADT Ltd in December.

"Based on the special relationship between ADT Operations and Chase, Chase had a duty to disclose to ADT Operations that it was advising and assisting Western in a hostile takeover attempt of the ADT companies," according to the ADT lawsuit.

"Had ADT Operations been advised of Chase's conduct with respect to Western, ADT Operations would have ceased providing confidential and proprietary information to Chase and would have terminated their relationship," the suit continued.
Officials from Chase and Western Resources could not be reached for comment.

The lawsuit said that Chase had access to sensitive confidential financial information about ADT and also held discussions with ADT senior management about the company's strategic programs and long-term plans.

The lawsuit also said that, when confronted about its relationship with Western, Chase said it believed the agreement not to assist in a hostile bid was no longer effective because ADT's previous planned merger with Repubic Industries Inc had put the company "in play."
Western Resources launched its bid for ADT after the planned merger with Republic collapsed.
ADT rejected Chase's argument, saying "there was a substantial difference between a consensual merger between two companies and a hostile effort by one company to take control of another company."
